DataElement.preferredDefinition: The description of the non-medical reason imaging was not completed.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Procedure Domain Imaging Technique Incomplete Variance Reason
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to procedure._Any technology or method that aids in the visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for use in screening, diagnosis, surgical procedures or therapy._Not whole; lacking some necessary part or detail; unfinished._A cause of a difference between what is expected and what actually occurs, or a cause of an activity that varies from a norm or standard.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to procedure.

Concepts.definition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to procedure.

Property.preferredDefinition: Any technology or method that aids in the visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for use in screening, diagnosis, surgical procedures or therapy.:Not whole; lacking some necessary part or detail; unfinished.:A cause of a difference between what is expected and what actually occurs, or a cause of an activity that varies from a norm or standard.

Concepts.definition: Any technology or method that aids in the visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for use in screening, diagnosis, surgical procedures or therapy.
Not whole; lacking some necessary part or detail; unfinished.
A cause of a difference between what is expected and what actually occurs, or a cause of an activity that varies from a norm or standard.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Released. AK 2020-6-12 Created for CDISC aligned NCI Standard CRF task. ghd

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A grouping to describe why the imaging exam was not initiated, performed or completed.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Diagnostic, Therapeutic, and Research Equipment Failure

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Diagnostic, Therapeutic, and Research Equipment Failure
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The device needed to perform or produce the diagnostic, therapeutic or research imaging did not function properly.

Concepts.definition: A manufactured object that is used to perform diagnostic, therapeutic or research activities.
A lack of occurrence or performance.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any special symptom or circumstance that renders the use of a remedy or the carrying out of a procedure inadvisable, usually because of the risk.

Concepts.definition: A symptom or medical condition that makes a particular treatment or procedure inadvisable because a person is likely to have a bad reaction.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Someone who takes part in an activity.: The cessation of life.

Concepts.definition: Someone who takes part in an activity.
The cessation of life.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 1/25/23 added alt name for ticket number CADSR0001948 for CCTG cjl.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Someone who takes part in an activity.: To decline to do, accept, give, or allow something.

Concepts.definition: Someone who takes part in an activity.
To decline to do, accept, give, or allow something.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Someone who takes part in an activity.: To cease active participation in; remove from active use.

Concepts.definition: Someone who takes part in an activity.
To cease active participation in; remove from active use.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A schedule is an ordered list of times at which things are planned to occur.: Problem; a state of difficulty that needs to be resolved.

Concepts.definition: An ordered list of times at which things are planned to occur.
A difficulty, disorder, or condition needing resolution.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Any record of an imaging event whether physical or electronic.:An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:Complete; having every necessary or normal part or component or step; or having come or been brought to a conclusion.:An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

Concepts.definition: Any record of an imaging event whether physical or electronic.
An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.
An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

ValueDomain.origin: ACRIN:American College of Radiology Imaging Network
